channel.title: Ryan's Garden on
channel.description: Recent content in Ryan's Garden on

item.title: elementary particles
item.description: They are [[particle physics/subatomic particles|subatomic particles]] that are not composed of other particles. Current elementary particles: [[particle physics/fermions|fermions]] [[particle physics/bosons|bosons]]

item.title: fermions
item.description: A particle that has a half-odd-integer spin (spin 1/2, spin 3/2, etc.) Fermions include: [[particle physics/quarks|quarks]] [[particle physics/leptons|leptons]]

item.title: Image Processing
item.description: [[image processing/sampling and quantization|Sampling and Quantization in Image Processing]] [[image processing/programming exercises (MATLAB)|Programming Exercises (MATLAB)]]

item.title: leptons
item.description: A lepton is an elementary particle with spin 1/2 that does not interact strongly ([[strong interactions]]) Two main types of leptons:

item.title: neutrinos
item.description: Neutrinos are fermions that only interact through [[weak interactions]] and [[gravity]]. They are electrically neutral and have very small rest mass.

item.title: Programming Exercises (MATLAB)
item.description: Write a computer program capable of reducing the number of intensity levels in an image from 256 to 2, in integer powers of 2.

item.title: Sampling and Quantization in Image Processing
item.description: Images mentioned in this post are from Digital Image Processing (3rd edition), by Rafael C. Gonzalez, Richard E. Woods. I don’t have the permission to use them here.

item.title: subatomic particles
item.description: Particles that compose an atom. A subatomic particle can be either a [[particle physics/composite particles|composite particle]] (made up of other particles, such as a proton, neutron, or meson) or an [[particle physics/elementary particles|elementary particle]] (made up of no other particles).
